# NSAnimation.Curve

**Enumeration**

These constants describe the curve of an animation—that is, the relative speed of an animation from start to finish.

## Declaration

```swift
enum Curve
```

## Overview

You initialize an `NSAnimation` object using one of these constants with [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAnimation/init(duration:animationCurve:)] and you can set it thereafter with the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAnimation/animationCurve] property.

## Constants

- **NSAnimation.Curve.easeInOut**: Describes an S-curve in which the animation slowly speeds up and then slows down near the end of the animation. This constant is the default.
- **NSAnimation.Curve.easeIn**: Describes an animation that slows down as it reaches the end.
- **NSAnimation.Curve.easeOut**: Describes an animation that slowly speeds up from the start.
- **NSAnimation.Curve.linear**: Describes an animation in which there is no change in frame rate.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Constants

- **NSAnimation.BlockingMode**: These constants indicate the blocking mode of an `NSAnimation` object when it is running.
- **NSAnimation.Progress**: The animation progress, as a floating-point number between `0.0` and `1.0`.
- **NSAnimationProgressMark Notification Key**: This constant is returned in the userInfo dictionary of the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSAnimation/progressMarkNotification] notification.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
